intro: Rochea, commonly known as the "Rocky Mountain flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing in rocky soils and crevices. They have small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. Rochea species are adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water use. Their foliage is usually succulent, helping them store moisture for extended periods.
